title: Drawing, "Design for South Wall of the Music Room", 1818–19
medium: Brush and gouache,  graphite on white wove paper
markings: Stamp: Cooper Union Museum stamp on verso
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of Mrs. John Innes Kane
description: Wall decoration composed of single painted panel of a dragon horse and a devil dancer to left and right, framed above by two coiled serpents. Panel is flanked by paintings of columns entwined by serpents. Other elements indicated in outline, in pencil.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Design for South Wall of the Music Room", 1818–19.
1818–19. Brush and gouache,  graphite on white wove paper. Museum purchase through gift of Mrs. John Innes Kane. 1948-40-12.
